message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses active learning strategies in the context of machine learning, which is a topic that falls under several sub-categories in the arXiv CS section. The focus on uncertainty sampling and probabilistic measures suggests that cs.LG (Machine Learning) is the most likely sub-category. The use of these techniques in computer vision (cs.CV) and natural language processing (cs.CL) is also possible, but less likely given the absence of specific references to these areas in the abstract. The paper's emphasis on uncertainty and prediction also suggests that cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) are relevant sub-categories. Finally, the mention of a concrete approach for measuring uncertainty suggests that cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) may also be relevant, as this sub-category includes papers on data analysis and modeling.
